Annotation Interface Index

@Retention(CLASS) @Target({TYPE,FIELD}) @Documented @Repeatable(Indexes.class) public @interface Index
Annotation for defining indexes in types.
Since:
2.8.2
Author:
shanon84 and Michael Simons

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static @interface 
    Index.Option
    A key value based option for index creation.
    static enum 
    Index.Type
    An enumeration of possible index types.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    Index.Type
    indexType
    index type for the index.
    String
    label
    If this is not null it has precedence over an implicit label (either no class annotations or one without a dedicated label) but not over OGM or SDN6 annotations specifying the label or type explicitly.
    Index.Option[]
    options
    Use this if you want to have more configured options for your index.
    String[]
    properties
    Use this if you want to define composite, Index when using Index on the class level.

  • Element Details

    • label

      String label
      If this is not null it has precedence over an implicit label (either no class annotations or one without a dedicated label) but not over OGM or SDN6 annotations specifying the label or type explicitly. Its use must be consistent throughout the class.
      Returns:
      the target label
      Default:
      ""

    • properties

      String[] properties
      Use this if you want to define composite, Index when using Index on the class level. Leave it empty when using on field level, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
      Returns:
      the list of properties to include in the composite.
      Default:
      {}

    • indexType

      Index.Type indexType
      index type for the index.
      Returns:
      indexType
      Default:
      PROPERTY

    • options

      Index.Option[] options
      Use this if you want to have more configured options for your index. Be aware to activate the option to allow further options on index creation. Example: "`fulltext.analyzer`:whitespace" to set the fulltext analyzer for your index.
      Returns:
      array of options
      Default:
      {}
